title: USGS Contract Ensures Continued Answers to Customer Inquiries

und.value: As part of their continuing efforts to answer nearly one million inquiries each year, the U.S. Geological Survey has awarded The Orkand Corporation of Tysons Corner, Virginia, a $22.5 million contract for technical support services. Orkand will be providing map sales and inquiry support to the USGS Earth Science Information Centers in Reston, Virginia, Washington, D.C., and other locations across the country. The Centers answer customer questions on a wide range of mapping, biological, geologic and water resources issues. The contract also provides audio-visual support for the USGS Visitor Center in Reston, maintenance of the National Mapping Program reference and historical map collections, and computer programming services.
